snippet: Recent political shifts have given the Obama administration an opening to build a new relationship with Cuba, including formal diplomatic ties.
abstract: Editorial urges Pres Obama to take hard look at Cuba, where major policy shift could yield significant policy success; contends for the first time in more than 50 years it is politically feasible to re-establish formal diplomatic relations and dismantle senseless embargo; calls for removing Cuba from State Dept's list of nations that sponsor terrorist organizations as first step.
lead_paragraph: Recent political shifts have given the Obama administration an opening to build a new relationship with Cuba, including formal diplomatic ties.

headline.main: Obama Should End the Embargo on Cuba
headline.print_headline: The Moment to Restore Ties to Cuba
